sentence.text: Age-related hearing impairment (regulation of cyclin-dependent protein serine/threonine kinase activity), one of the most common sensory disorders, can be mitigated, but not cured or eliminated.

entity.text: regulation of cyclin-dependent protein serine/threonine kinase activity

sentence.text: The latter SNP lies just outside exon 8 and is highly correlated (r2 = 0.96) with the missense SNP rs5756795 in exon 7 of positive regulation of substrate adhesion-dependent cell spreading, a gene previously associated with prelingual nonsyndromic hearing loss.

entity.text: positive regulation of substrate adhesion-dependent cell spreading

sentence.text: We also tested variants within exons of 132 other previously-identified hearing loss genes, and identified two common additional significant SNPs: rs2877561 (synonymous change in protein homooligomerization, p = 6.2x10-5), which replicated in the UK Biobank (p = 0.00057), and had a significant GERA SRT (p = 0.00019) and speech discrimination score (mitotic spindle organization; p = 0.0019); and rs9493627 (missense change in visual perception, p = 0.00011) which replicated in the UK Biobank (p = 0.0095), other GERA groups (p = 0.0080), and had a consistent significant result for SRT (p = 0.041) and suggestive result for SDS (p = 0.081).
